Key Match Events: Ball hit an even deeper three a few minutes later.
He made a beautiful cut to hit a reverse layup, too.
Here he is blocking Julius Randle:
And here he is making one of his signature off-ball rotations to force a steal, and then leap into the sidelines to save the ball:
Pre-Game Insights: Ball was a master at improvisation, seeing the game in a fifth dimension with an innate sense of spacing, timing, and possibility.
Ace shooting coach Fred Vinson fixed the hitch in his jump shot. Suddenly, Ball was one of the best three-point shooters in the world.
On one possession, Ball would be holding up in the post against more powerful forwards. On the next, he’d be zooming in for a quick trap and swiping the ball free.
Post-Match Reflections: The Bulls are still very much half-finished with their teardown.
This sport just wasn’t the same without him.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Bulls gave Ball the game ball after his preseason return. What a cathartic moment for the player and the team.
Lonzo Ball is a one-and-done at UCLA, and the No. 2 overall pick in the 2017 NBA Draft to his hometown Los Angeles Lakers.
